Package.label: 6.02 Variables, Expressions, and Values
Package.description: Gives student a variable and an expression, and then asks student to apply that information to solve for different scenarios and values of the variable.

Problem.name: Intro Problem
Problem.label: Wendy's Barbeque
Problem.description: Wendy wants to host a barbeque in her backyard. To prepare for how many veggie burgers she will need to buy, she uses a formula depending on how many people are going to show up.

Problem.name: Problem1
Problem.label: CDs-R-Us
Problem.description: The website CDs-R-Us sells music CDs. You can buy as many CDs as you want each time you order.

Problem.name: Problem10
Problem.label: Baseball Cards
Problem.description: Bobby has been collecting baseball cards for as long as he can remember, and now he has more cards than anyone he knows. Because his collection is so large, Bobby decides to share any cards he gets for his birthday with his brothers.

Problem.name: Problem2
Problem.label: Andy's Summer Job
Problem.description: Andy borrowed money from his parents to buy the new Space Rider video game. To pay them back, Andy decides to walk dogs for his neighbors during the summer. He hopes the summer job will also give him some extra spending money.

Problem.name: Problem3
Problem.label: Halloween Cookies
Problem.description: The class Halloween part is coming up and Alice wants to bring in pumpkin cookies as gits for her classmates and her teacher, Miss Bird.

Problem.name: Problem4
Problem.label: Danny Perfume
Problem.description: Danny wants to buy his mom a bottle of her favorite perfume for her birthday, but doesn't have quite enough money in his piggy bank for the gift.

Problem.name: Problem5
Problem.label: Emily in Wonder World
Problem.description: Wonder World, a local amusement park, just opened for the season and Emily's class is taking an all-day field trip there. Emily's parents buy her enough tickets in advance to get into the park and go on as many rides as she wants.

Problem.name: Problem6
Problem.label: Art Competition
Problem.description: The students in Mr. Whistler's art class want to enter the city-wide art competition. Not only will it be fun to work together on a big project, but a big check goes to the winning group. Mr. Whistler borrows from the class funds to pay for the brushes.

Problem.name: Problem7
Problem.label: Susie's Spending
Problem.description: Susie has a bad habit of spending all of the money her parents give her for her allowance, and now she wants to try to save some of it. She gathers up all of the money she has and puts it in a piggy bank.

Problem.name: Problem8
Problem.label: Raffle
Problem.description: A raffle is being held at Mark's school, with the grand prize being a very large amount of money. Mark borrows money from his brother to purchase a book of tickets for the raffle.

Problem.name: Problem9
Problem.label: Sunshine Cadets
Problem.description: Beth's Sunshine Cadet troop is selling boxes of chocolate. The money raised from the sale will go into the troop's charity fund, to be given to the local children's hospital.

ProblemSet.name: 6.02 HTML
ProblemSet.label: 6.02 Variables, Expressions, and Values
ProblemSet.description: Gives student a variable and an expression, and then asks student to apply that information to solve for different scenarios and values of the variable.

Skill.name: y-value
Skill.label: Calculate a Y value from an X value
Skill.description: Calculate a Y value from an X value

Standard.name: PA.D.2
Standard.label: D.2. Represent Situations and Structures
Standard.description: D.2. Represent and/or analyze mathematical situations and structures using algebraic symbols, words, tables, and graphs.
